description.narrative: Children and their families are consulted for the elaboration & monitoring of the project and have access to life saving information and protective practices on access and use of services. Adolescent migrants are engaged as peer educators. In order to reduce discrimination and xenophobia, the host community is made aware of the rights and needs of the migrant population.

sector.narrative: Public health emergencies, including disease outbreaks
Situation Analysis or Update on women and children
System strengthening - inclusive education for other vulnerable children poorest quintile, ethnic/linguistic minorities, migrant children, non-citizens/undocumented children etc.

title.narrative: Brazil Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Enhanced Policies for Excluded Children)
UNICEF Programmes in Brazil (Citizen engagement and participation)
"UNICEF Programmes in Brazil (Policies Monitoring and Cooperations)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Brazil 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Brazil Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children and their families are consulted for the elaboration & monitoring of the project and have access to life saving information and protective practices on access and use of services. Adolescent migrants are engaged as peer educators. In order to reduce discrimination and xenophobia, the host community is made aware of the rights and needs of the migrant population.

description.narrative: UNICEF facilitated the systematic access to life saving information and promotion of healthy behavior, engaged adolescents and established a feedback mechanism on quality and relevance of services. UNICEF activities were kept under high profile on national media and social network. In term of social inclusion, UNICEF is conducting a study on the integration of Venezuelan in the “Bolsa Familia” national social protection system and supported the interiorization process through the Seal of Approval strategy by integrating the migratory context and complexity | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/02/2020

title.narrative: People reached with key life- saving & behaviour change messages on xenophobia
Coverage of regional level multi-country or multi-sector evaluations
People reached by mechanisms to voice their needs/concerns
AAP Framework developed and implementation tracked
Communication and community engagement platforms/ mechanisms supported by UNICEF meet quality standards across development priorities
Multi-Level C4D intervention to promote non-discrimination of specific group/s meets quality standards
